name: Greater Kudu
description: The Greater Kudu is a large antelope with spiral horns and a graceful build.
spread_note: Found in eastern and southern Africa, including Tanzania and South Africa.
food_note: Browses in wooded areas, often at dusk.
proportions: Height: 1.2-1.5 m, length: 2-2.5 m, weight: 120-300 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 9 months, one calf born.
attractions: Striking in zoos due to their impressive horns and elegance.
projects_note: Not endangered, but habitat loss is a concern.
breeding: Bred in captivity for conservation and display.
